intro: Polygala galapageia, commonly known as the Galapagos milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the Galápagos Islands. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in coastal areas and rocky habitats. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are narrow and opposite, and it produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. Polygala galapageia plays a role in the local ecosystem, providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of the islands.
